New Records: Aaron Judge ended the longest home run drought of his career with a go-ahead grand slam, his 52nd homer of the season, and 130 RBI leading the majors.
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge hit a go-ahead grand slam in the seventh inning to rally the Yankees to a 5-4 victory over the Red Sox.
Mark Leiter Jr. pitched effectively in relief for the win.
Trevor Story hit a two-run shot off Leiter in the seventh for a 4-0 lead.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees won their third straight game and extended their AL East lead to three games over Baltimore.
Judge had gone 16 games and 75 plate appearances without a home run before the grand slam.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Manager Aaron Boone mentioned that Judge would likely be the designated hitter the next day to give him a breather.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was held at Yankee Stadium with an attendance of 45,292.
Red Sox pitcher Richard Fitts pitched five shutout innings after Tanner Houck was scratched due to injury.
Others: The article includes detailed box score and play-by-play information, as well as post-game quotes and reflections.
